alert.note: Alert for Barton; Cedar; Dade; Jasper; Lawrence; Newton; St. Clair; Vernon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 14 at 7:01PM CDT until July 14 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Barton County in southwestern Missouri... Northeastern Newton County in southwestern Missouri... Cedar County in southwestern Missouri... Lawrence County in southwestern Missouri... Southwestern St. Clair County in west central Missouri... Eastern Vernon County in west central Missouri... Eastern Jasper County in southwestern Missouri... Dade County in southwestern Missouri... * Until 745 PM CDT. * At 700 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Nevada to near Sheldon to near Jasper to Diamond to near Seneca, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Stockton Lake, Stockton State Park, Monett, Aurora, Mount Vernon, El Dorado Springs, Marionville, Stockton, Greenfield, Sarcoxie, Pierce City, Lockwood, Golden City, Miller, Verona, Everton, Montevallo, Walker, Schell City and Dadeville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 44 between mile markers 27 and 58. Interstate 49 near mile marker 104. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage across portions of southwestern Missouri. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows! If on or near Stockton Lake, get away from the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 15 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.

area.areaDesc: Barton; Cedar; Dade; Jasper; Lawrence; Newton; St. Clair; Vernon
